We constructed few-chain systems that have single, double,
triple, and septuple chain(s) by repeating the rotated unit cell
to obtain the target chain arrangements and by removing
redundancies. After the formation of the initial few SCAC
systems, we optimized the structures of SCACs and bulk
. The calculation was performed using the projected

caused by vdW interchain interactions. Previous studies of

inclined view (b) and projected view (c) to the plane perpendicular to
the length of chains are shown. A single cell has four chains. Two
chains are stacked in the bottom of the unit cell as the ﬁrst layer, and
two chains are stacked on the top of the unit cell as the second layer.
Two layers are shifted by a half-length between chains in each layer.
